arm_group.description: JOA (Japanese Orthopaedic Association) Scores for cervical myelopathy Compliance Rigidity activity unit

brief_summary.textblock:
Hypotheses:

      Decompressive surgery of cervical myelopathy will improve bladder function.

      Decompressive surgery of cervical myelopathy will improve sexual function.

clinical_study.brief_title: Urinary and Sexual Function Before and After Surgical Decompression of Cervical Myelopathy

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators will enroll consecutive cohort with cervical myelopathy who are scheduled
      to take surgical decompression of cervical spinal cord, aged between 25 and 65.

      The exams for the patients include followings

        -  JOA (Japanese Orthopaedic Association) Scores for cervical myelopathy

        -  VAS (Visual Analog Scale) pain score

        -  IPSS (International Prostate Symptom Score) and IIEF (International Index of Erectile
           Function) in male patients

        -  FSFI (Female Sexual Function Index) and UDI (Urinary Distress Inventory) in female
           patients

        -  Bladder compliance, Detrusor leak point pressure, Peak detrusor pressure

        -  Rigidity activity unit of penis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  evidence of progression of motor or sensory nerve

          -  cervical myelopathy in magnetic resonance imaging

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  radical pelvic surgery

          -  pelvic irradiation

          -  evidence of brain damage (dementia, cerebrovascular disease)

          -  evidence of psychotic disorder

study_pop.textblock: Patients having cervical myelopathy, aged between 25 and 65

facility.name: St. Vincent's Hospital, The Catholic University of Korea

clinical_study.official_title: Urinary and Sexual Function Before and After Surgical Decompression of Cervical Myelopathy

other_outcome.description: This study will be provided by nocturnal penile tumescence study and will show the intactness of psychogenic erectile pathway.
This will show the female patients' sexual arousal state.

primary_outcome.description: This score will provide patients' conditions at a glance.
primary_outcome.measure: JOA (Japanese Orthopaedic Association) Scores for cervical myelopathy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: This will be provided by urodynamic study, and will show the intactness of Guarding reflex from upper spinal cord tract.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
